meanings.definition: A chain of segments in the body of certain invertebrates, such as tapeworms.
meanings.sent1: The strobila of the tapeworm helps it to grow and reproduce.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the strobila of tapeworms to understand their anatomy.
meanings.sent3: The tapeworm's strobila decided to throw a party for its segments.
meanings.sent4: The strobila of the tapeworm resembled a string of pearls in the microscope.
meanings.sent5: Children in the science class were amazed by the intricate design of the tapeworm's strobila.

meanings.definition: The body of a tapeworm, consisting of a chain of proglottids.
meanings.sent1: After ingestion, the strobila of the tapeworm attaches to the host's intestine.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian examined the strobila of the tapeworm found in the dog's stool.
meanings.sent3: The tapeworm's strobila tried to break free and go on an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The strobila of the tapeworm looked like a string of beads under the microscope.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to explain the structure of the tapeworm's strobila to the students.
